WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description: Currently, when there are type errors, `tsc` returns 1 as its exit code, but still generates code. However, if there are fatal errors, like a parse error, `tsc` will also return exit code 1, but fail to generate code. It would be useful to me if `tsc` could generate a different error code in this case. This would allow a build system to continue in one case (with the type errors as warnings), but fail in the other (instead of e.g. using a stale file from a previous run).
WorkItem.Summary: tsc should have different exit code depending on if it generated code

Comments.Message: This seems like a pretty reasonable thing to do so that it's easier to script against tsc's output and exit codes. There's no good reason to always use the same exit code for all states, marked as a suggestion for a future release.
